description: David Ayton, who developed CDisplay, a now discontinued image viewer optimized for viewing free comic books, created and popularized the CBZ format (naming scheme) in the early 2000s. CDisplay also popularized several other comic book archive formats, with each format using a file extension that signifies its format:
NOTE: Besides PNG and JPEG images, CBZ files may also store .BMP , .TIFF , and .GIF images.
